intro: Monothrix palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Monothrix palmeri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
